meanings.definition: To eat improperly or in an unappetizing manner.
meanings.sent1: Please do not miseat your food by playing with it instead of eating.
meanings.sent2: She tends to miseat by mixing all her food together before taking a bite.
meanings.sent3: The toddler decided to miseat his spaghetti by using it as finger paint.
meanings.sent4: The picky eater would rather miseat than try new foods.
meanings.sent5: The loud crunching sound made by the man as he miseat his chips was quite unpleasant.

meanings.definition: To consume food in a way that is considered distasteful or offensive.
meanings.sent1: It is impolite to miseat by talking with your mouth full.
meanings.sent2: The guests were shocked to see him miseat by slurping his soup.
meanings.sent3: She always manages to miseat by making loud chewing noises during meals.
meanings.sent4: The comedian joked that his friend would miseat by eating pizza with a fork.
meanings.sent5: The movie character would deliberately miseat to annoy his dining companions.
